meanings.definition: To claim or seize without justification
meanings.sent1: He arrogated the last cookie without asking.
meanings.sent2: The bully arrogated the swing at the park.
meanings.sent3: She arrogated all the credit for the group project.
meanings.sent4: The cat arrogated the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent5: The king arrogated the throne, declaring himself ruler.

meanings.definition: To attribute or assign to oneself without authority
meanings.sent1: The student arrogated intelligence by copying answers.
meanings.sent2: She arrogated the title of team captain.
meanings.sent3: He arrogated the role of class clown, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The actor arrogated the persona of a famous historical figure.
meanings.sent5: The chef arrogated the recipe as his own creation.
